name: places/ChIJmfQlvYNYwokRpX2TUjJsfx8
adrFormatAddress: 2412 Broadway, New York, NY 10024-1710, USA

editorialSummary.text: Retailer featuring Jewish-focused books & religious gifts & items, such as menorahs & mezuzahs.

originalText.text: This store and its staff are simply fantastic. They have an amazing assortment of books and items of all variety related to Jewish life. Sadly, they didn't have any books on Indian or Ethiopian Jews today, but we found a lovely menorah and set of gilded candles, dreidel and hand-painted spice box. The staff were very personable, and answered our many questions with kindness. I look forward to visitng them again soon.

originalText.text: They are wonderful people and it is a wonderful store. God bless you all!

originalText.text: There‚Äôs a great selection of items to choose from. The customer service was really great. Enjoy!

originalText.text: Got some terrific gifts and cards for a special occasion and the staff were really helpful going through the jewelry. Books and Judaica for all events, holidays and styles.

text.text: Got some terrific gifts and cards for a special occasion and the staff were really helpful going through the jewelry. Books and Judaica for all events, holidays and styles.

originalText.text:
Disclaimer - this describes an incident experienced yesterday by a dear friend who visited this shop and returned in tears üò¢üò≠üò°.

My friend is a convert to Judaism, and had popped in to purchase things for Shabbat. She described how a man - she wasn‚Äôt sure if he was an employee, fellow shopper, or friend of employees - was acting friendly and helpful, suggesting items, when the conversation abruptly shifted into a rant:

Complaining about Kanye West and anti-semitism and how ‚ÄúAfrican Americans have had it easy, only 400 years of oppression‚Äù vs. the thousands suffered by the Jewish people, how y‚Äôall need to take responsibility and get educated and then you can achieve what we have, etc etc etc üò≥üò≥üò≥.

Did I mention that my friend is African American? She says she just froze in shock, noticing that other people/employees were within earshot, but no one intervened. Then a kindly female *customer* wandered over and distracted her, getting her away from the man, whispering ‚Äúyou looked like you needed help.‚Äù She was extremely grateful - whoever that woman is, THANK YOU for being a blessing at that moment.

To the store owners/employees: whether that unhinged male individual was an employee, a friend, or just some random person off the street, it‚Äôs upsetting to hear that employees were around, yet did nothing to shut down the blatantly racist harassment occurring right before their eyes. My poor young friend was crushed - as a convert, she was already self-conscious, and this only serves to alienate further.

I do hope that the management will hear this story and take steps to prevent future incidents. Singling out a customer for the color of her skin - or witnessing racism but refusing to intervene - it reflects poorly on your business, not to mention your collective sense of humanity. Please do better.
